column4: your info is soo vague     does/did windows detect the disks  be fore you tried ubuntu?   jumpers wrong?   ide channel enabled in bios?
windows detected the disks before i had windows installed, but the computer has aged since then, does someone know how i can check if the disks works?
you could try a live_CD  in a terminal type  fdisk -l  to see detected drives/partitions   you could reinstall any windows OS just to make sure the jumpers and drives are working
drives not detected can be alot of things    until you rule out hardware setup  fixing possible Linux errors is a pain
